pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhaddāya kāpilāniyā antevāsiniyā bhikkhuniyā ñātako puriso gāmakā sāvatthiṃ agamāsi kenacideva karaṇīyena.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.2.eng: a male relative of a nun who was a pupil of Bhaddā Kāpilānī went from his own village to Sāvatthī on some business.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.3.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī tena purisena saddhiṃ rattandhakāre appadīpe ekenekā santiṭṭhatipi sallapatipi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.3.eng: Then, in the dark of the night and without a lamp, that nun stood and talked alone with that man.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.4.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.4.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhunī rattandhakāre appadīpe purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā santiṭṭhissatipi sallapissatipī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.5.eng: “How could a nun do such a thing?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.6.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī rattandhakāre appadīpe purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā santiṭṭhatipi sallapatipī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.6.eng: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.9.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī rattandhakāre appadīpe purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā santiṭṭhissatipi sallapissatipi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.9.eng: “How could a nun do such a thing?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.11.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.11.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.12.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī rattandhakāre appadīpe purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā santiṭṭheyya vā sallapeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.12.1.eng: ‘If, in the dark of the night without a lamp, a nun stands or talks alone with a man, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.5.eng: In the dark of the night:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.10.pli: manussapuriso na yakkho na peto na tiracchānagato viññū paṭibalo santiṭṭhituṃ sallapituṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.10.eng: a human male, not a male spirit, not a male ghost, not a male animal. He understands and is capable of standing together and talking.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.14.eng: just the man and the nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.16.eng: if she stands within arm’s reach of the man, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.18.pli: purisassa hatthapāse ṭhitā sallapati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.18.eng: if she stands talking within arm’s reach of the man, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.19.pli: Hatthapāsaṃ vijahitvā santiṭṭhati vā sallapati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.19.eng: If she stands or talks outside of arm’s reach, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.20.pli: Yakkhena vā petena vā paṇḍakena vā tiracchānagatamanussaviggahena vā saddhiṃ santiṭṭhati vā sallapati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.20.eng: If she stands or talks with a male spirit, a male ghost, a paṇḍaka, or a male animal in human form, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.20.comm: For a discussion of paṇḍaka, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.2.2.eng: if she has a companion who understands;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.2.3.eng: if she is not seeking privacy;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.2.4.eng: if she stands or talks thinking of something else;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.2.4.comm: Sp 5.467: Aññavihitoti aññaṁ cintayamāno, “Aññavihita: thinking of something else.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.2.6.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.2.7.eng: The first training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:0.5.eng: The training rule on dismissing a companion

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī rathikāyapi byūhepi siṅghāṭakepi purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā santiṭṭhatipi sallapatipi nikaṇṇikampi jappeti dutiyikampi bhikkhuniṃ uyyojeti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Thullanandā stood and talked alone with men on streets, in cul-de-sacs, and at intersections, and she whispered in their ears and dismissed her companion nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.3.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.3.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā rathikāyapi byūhepi siṅghāṭakepi purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā santiṭṭhissatipi sallapissatipi nikaṇṇikampi jappissati dutiyikampi bhikkhuniṃ uyyojessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.4.eng: “How can Venerable Thullanandā do such things?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī rathikāyapi byūhepi siṅghāṭakepi purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā santiṭṭhatipi sallapatipi nikaṇṇikampi jappeti dutiyikampi bhikkhuniṃ uyyojetī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā does this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.8.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī rathikāyapi byūhepi siṅghāṭakepi purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā santiṭṭhissatipi sallapissatipi nikaṇṇikampi jappissati dutiyikampi bhikkhuniṃ uyyojessati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.8.eng: “How can the nun Thullanandā do such things?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.10.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.10.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.11.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī rathikāya vā byūhe vā siṅghāṭake vā purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā santiṭṭheyya vā sallapeyya vā nikaṇṇikaṃ vā jappeyya dutiyikaṃ vā bhikkhuniṃ uyyojeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.11.1.eng: ‘If a nun stands or talks alone with a man on a street or in a cul-de-sac or at an intersection, or she whispers in his ear or dismisses her companion nun, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.6.eng: a carriage road is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.8.eng: one departs the same way one enters.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.10.eng: a crossroads is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.12.pli: manussapuriso na yakkho na peto na tiracchānagato viññū paṭibalo santiṭṭhituṃ sallapituṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.12.eng: a human male, not a male spirit, not a male ghost, not a male animal. He understands and is capable of standing together and talking.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.16.eng: just the man and the nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.18.eng: if she stands within arm’s reach of the man, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.20.pli: purisassa hatthapāse ṭhitā sallapati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.20.eng: if she stands talking within arm’s reach of the man, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.22.eng: if she speaks into the ear of a man, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.24.pli: anācāraṃ ācaritukāmā dutiyikampi bhikkhuniṃ uyyojeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.24.eng: if, wanting to misbehave, she dismisses her companion nun, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.25.pli: Dassanūpacāraṃ vā savanūpacāraṃ vā vijahantiyā āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.25.eng: If the companion nun is in the process of going beyond the range of sight or the range of hearing, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.26.eng: When the companion nun has gone beyond, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.1.pli: Hatthapāsaṃ vijahitvā santiṭṭhati vā sallapati vā āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.1.eng: If she stands or talks outside of arm’s reach, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.2.pli: Yakkhena vā petena vā paṇḍakena vā tiracchānagatamanussaviggahena vā saddhiṃ santiṭṭhati vā sallapati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.2.eng: If she stands or talks with a male spirit, a male ghost, a paṇḍaka, or a male animal in human form, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.4.eng: if she has a companion who understands;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.4.comm: This non-offense clause is noteworthy in that it seems to contradict the “or” structure of the rule. The rule suggests that there is an offense if any of the five sub-clauses are fulfilled, whereas this non-offense clause says that there is no offense if the last clause is not fulfilled.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.5.eng: if she is not seeking privacy;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.6.eng: if she stands or talks thinking of something else;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.6.comm: Sp 5.467: Aññavihitoti aññaṁ cintayamāno, “Aññavihita: thinking of something else.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.7.eng: if she does not want to misbehave;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.8.eng: if she dismisses her companion nun when there is something to be done;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.10.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.11.eng: The fourth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:0.4.eng: The subchapter on the dark of the night

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:0.5.eng: The training rule on departing without informing

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā bhikkhunī aññatarassa kulassa kulūpikā hoti niccabhattikā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.2.eng: At that time a certain nun was associating with a family from which she received a regular meal.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.3.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena taṃ kulaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āsane nisīditvā sāmike anāpucchā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.3.eng: Then, after robing up one morning, she took her bowl and robe and went to that family where she sat down on a seat. She then departed without informing the owners.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.4.pli: Tassa kulassa dāsī gharaṃ sammajjantī taṃ āsanaṃ bhājanantarikāya pakkhipi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.4.eng: A slave-woman who was sweeping the house put that seat in between some vessels.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.5.pli: Manussā taṃ āsanaṃ apassantā taṃ bhikkhuniṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.5.eng: Not seeing the seat, soon afterwards the people there asked that nun,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.8.eng: “Give back the seat, Venerable.” And after scolding her, they made an end of her regular meal.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.9.pli: Atha kho te manussā gharaṃ sodhentā taṃ āsanaṃ bhājanantarikāya passitvā taṃ bhikkhuniṃ khamāpetvā niccabhattaṃ paṭṭhapesuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.9.eng: Then, while those people were cleaning the house, they saw that seat in between those vessels. They asked that nun for forgiveness and restored her regular meal.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.10.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.10.eng: That nun then told the nuns what had happened.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.11.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.11.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.12.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhunī purebhattaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamitvā āsane nisīditvā sāmike anāpucchā pakkamissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.12.eng: “How could a nun visit a family before the meal, sit down on a seat, and then depart without informing the owners?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.13.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī purebhattaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamitvā āsane nisīditvā sāmike anāpucchā pakkamatī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.13.eng: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.16.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave bhikkhunī purebhattaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamitvā āsane nisīditvā sāmike anāpucchā pakkamissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.16.eng: “How could a nun act like this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.18.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.18.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.19.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī purebhattaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamitvā āsane nisīditvā sāmike anāpucchā pakkameyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.19.1.eng: ‘If a nun visits families before the meal, sits down on a seat, and then departs without informing the owners, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.1.8.pli: cattāri kulāni— khattiyakulaṃ, brāhmaṇakulaṃ, vessakulaṃ, suddakulaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.1.8.eng: there are four kinds of families: the aristocratic family, the brahmin family, the merchant family, the worker family.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.1.12.eng: a place for sitting cross-legged is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.1.16.pli: yo tasmiṃ kule manusso viññū taṃ anāpucchā anovassakaṃ atikkāmentiyā āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.1.16.eng: if, without informing a person who understands in that family, she goes beyond the roof cover of that house, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.1.17.eng: If it is out in the open and she goes beyond the vicinity of the seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.2.1.eng: If she has not informed, and she does not perceive that she has, and she departs, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.2.2.eng: If she has not informed, but she is unsure of it, and she departs, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.2.3.eng: If she has not informed, but she perceives that she has, and she departs, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.2.4.eng: If it is not a place for sitting cross-legged, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.2.5.eng: If she has informed, but she does not perceive that she has, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.2.6.eng: If she has informed, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.2.7.eng: If she has informed, and she perceives that she has, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.3.2.eng: if she departs after informing someone;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.3.3.eng: if the seat is not movable;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.3.7.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.3.8.eng: The fifth training rule is finished.
